p:
After one month of treatment, the relative moisture content of the discolored sapwood induced by each treatment was significantly higher than that of natural heartwood (NH) ( p < 0.05). The relative moisture content of each treatment was significantly reduced after three months compared to one month of treatment ( p < 0.05), which were not significantly different from that of NH (
Figure 7 ). These results indicated that the water in the sapwood continuously reduced during induced discoloration of the sapwood, and the relative moisture content level approached that of the natural heartwood after three months of treatment.
